definitions: To remove obstructions or unwanted items from.
To make or become free of doubt, confusion, or guilt.
To pass over or through without touching.
To obtain official approval or authorization for.
To make a net profit of (an amount of money).
examples: Please clear the table after dinner.
The sky began to clear after the storm.
The horse cleared the fence easily.
The new drug has been cleared for use.
He hopes to clear a substantial profit this quarter.
